thread.title: Phase-2 training programme for DNOs, ZNOs concludes at SCERT Jammu
thread.title_full: Phase-2 training programme for DNOs, ZNOs concludes at SCERT Jammu

author: Daily Excelsior
title: Phase-2 training programme for DNOs, ZNOs concludes at SCERT Jammu
text:
JAMMU, Sept 17: Two-day training-cum-orientation programme (Phase-2), organised by the Department of Population Education, Girlsâ€™ Education, ECCE and Education for all, for District Nodal Officers (DNOs) and Zonal Nodal Officers (ZNOs) of NIPUN Bharat, Foundational Literacy and Numeracy (FLN), Early Childhood Care and Education (ECCE), and Vidya Pravesh at The State Council of Educational Research and Training (SCERT), Jammu Division, concluded today.
Dr Sanjeevani, Head ECCE, Programme Coordinator, presented a concise concept note, setting the tone for the event. She highlighted the vision of NIPUN Bharat and the National Curriculum Framework for Foundational Stage (NCF-FS), emphasising the importance of holistic, play-based, and activity-oriented learning in the early years.
Over the period of two days, seven technical sessions were delivered, wherein Anil Sharma, Associate Coordinator, deliberated on NEP/NCF-FS/NIPUN Bharat/FLN, and Jaadui Pitara, succeeded by sessions on Organizing Pre-Primary Classrooms by Geeta Bharti, Jaswinder Kour on Numeracy, Shashi Bala on Literacy and Kamini Verma on Vidya Pravesh. The sessions were aimed at equipping participants with practical strategies for classroom implementation.
A committee comprising Shazia, Dr Bhuvi, Rukhsana, Kamini and Neeraj Jamwal, substantially contributed to the success of the event. Yugal Kishore and Anil Sharma handled all the technical aspects with finesse.
The orientation programme was aimed to empower DNOs and ZNOs with the necessary knowledge, skills, and tools to serve as effective monitors and mentors in their respective districts and zones. A formal vote of thanks was presented by Dr Sanjeevani, Head, ECCE.
